inn1.comm: on off stump, Carberry gets behind the line and defends to the leg side
walks into his defensive shot and plays it square to point
worked into the leg side to get off the mark
lovely from Pietersen. whips this from well outside off stump with a strong flick of the bottom hand through midwicket
on a length outside off, this time he shoulders arms...decent carry through to Wade

what a shambles! The ball bobbles into the leg side off the thigh pad, Pietersen wanted to keep strike, Carberry wasn't moving at the non-striker's end and by the time he did set off Pietersen was almost down to meet him. McKay had plenty of time to run from his follow through, pick up the ball, and make his way to the stumps. Carberry leaves fuming. He reckons he's been sold down the river by KP. Did look like a single if Carberry had gone straight away
beats him straight away with a very full delivery outside off, hint of swing, Wade starts an appeal but Pietersen wasn't near it
finds the edge, good line going across Pietersen outside off, he pushed at the ball but it reasonably soft hands and it went to ground well in front of second slip
left alone outside off, hint of shape back into Pietersen
91mph, no footwork, pushing out in front of his body and gets a think inside edge to the leg side
92mph, goes full at leg stump but just gets the line fractionally wrong and it slips down the leg side...it did swing, though
adjusts his line outside off and it's left alone
neatly flicked off his hip wide of leg slip, it was in the air, nicely timed towards long leg who makes a sliding save on the boundary

big appeal! No shot from Pietersen. He padded up to this delivery which nipped back from a full length outside off. Aleem Dar shakes his head. Clarke doesn't review. Replays show it was missing off stump
flicked behind square on the leg side
very wide and swinging away further, Wade can't collect it was he dives in front of first slip. The ball dipped at the last moment and went under his glove
back on off stump, defended to mid-on
outside off, chopped down to third man
gets across his crease and works this straight delivery to square leg
flashes at width outside off, was a stand-and-deliver stroke without much footwork, and the ball fizzes past the edge
on leg stump, flicked through square leg and it's place wide enough of long leg for a comfortable second
sends this down the leg side again, another awkward take for Wade
good delivery, nips into Trott from around off stump and he has to jab down late...takes the inside edge into his pads
fraction shorter this time, Trott is more comfortable as he's already on the back foot and drops it towards mid-off for a well-judged single
90mph, full outside off stump, Pietersen gets a good stride forward and defends firmly to point
full outside off, left alone
very full, on the popping crease, squeezed out to backward point
edged down to third man...only one slip, which is a bit odd, although this probably wouldn't have carried to second. Johnson slides around the rope to cut off the boundary
short of a length, flicked to square leg
nicely placed through square leg, Trott's meat-and-drink shot, as he gives long leg another scamper around the boundary
short of a length outside off, dropped backward of square on the off side
back of a length outside, defended to midwicket
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
back of a length, down the leg side and there's a muted appeal as the ball flicks Trott's thigh pad on its way through
angled across, opens the face and runs a single through backward point

miscued pull and Pietersen is out, simply caught at square leg! MJ has beaten KP for pace there, the ball was on to him before he got through the stroke, came off the bat near the splice and looped gently, straight to the man on the edge of the ring. England's experimental opening pair are back in the lab
drops back and defends solidly around the line of off
fired across on a good length, lets this one through
bit of width, Root plays a wristy dab behind square for a single down to third man. Off a blob
good-length bal, holds its line on off, Root plays late a a thickish edge runs through backward point
shuffles across and shows a length ball the maker's name in front of off
Trott steps forward and opens up his body to drive, gets a chunk of outside edge and it runs to third man
dances out of the crease, tries to whip the ball from off stump through midwicket for doesn't connect cleanly
comes forward again, squirts the ball behind point, good running brings two as third man lollops round
beaten, that's a G-string line from McKay, teasing Root into a poke and a miss
zips a length ball past the outside edge, Trott coming forward and playing inside the line

skidding on, Trott plays across his pads and is pinned on the crease - up goes the finger but Trott decides to review! The only question really is whether it pitched outside leg, the ball clearly would have demolished leg stump ... but the replays show definitively that it landed outside the line of leg before striking the pad. Trott took a while consulting with Root before playing the DRS card but it was a sound review
digs in a short ball, aiming for the top of the block of England's top blocker, Trott manages to shovel it through square leg for a couple
fired across the bows outside off stump, left alone
another speed fishing exercise in the corridor, no stroke
goes round the wicket now, fires it in fill and straight, Trott digs it out and the ball rolls slowly towards the slips
fullish, Root narrows the distance even further, works the ball wide of mid-on for a single
defends a length ball outside off
tighter, the ball just shaping back a little, Trott knows where his off stump is and shoulders arms
pitched up and punched back down the track, McKay gets a finger on it but only takes the pace off
coming across his stumps, lets the ball through outside off
comes forward and drives back towards the bowler, who stops it effectively enough
a fiery bouncer sears through and nearly takes Trott's nose off, as he jerks out of the way
well timed off the pads, Trott plays one of his favourite clips to leg and the ball beats long leg to the rope

Trott is caught walking in front of his stumps again, this time umpire Gough turns down the appeal - once burned and all that - but Australia decide to review. This is definitely in line but height may well be a question, it hit Trott above the knee roll ... and Hawk-Eye shows it clipping the bail over middle and leg, it's orange, so umpire's call and the not-out decision stands
pushed across outside off stump, played square coming forwards
CLANG! Trott is having all sorts of difficulty against Johnson, this time a short ball hurries on at smashes into the grill of his helmet as he attempted to pull

Johnson continues with his bodyline attack, this time Trott is equal to it, scooping a short, straight ball in the air through backward square leg, well wide of the man stationed fine and it bounces to the rope
tight line outside off, Root covers his stumps
slightly overpitched and this is gloriously played, an on drive straight down the ground and it outruns the man at mid-on, despite the damp outfield
lets another length delivery through outside off
touch too full and wide of the stumps, Root leans into a drive, a bump-ball flies into the hands of cover, to a few gasps in the crowd
good length, outside off and just curling away a touch, no stroke offered
strays on to the pads and Root nurdles a single through square
on the stumps and glanced through square for another to Root
slightly short but the ball doesn't get up a great deal and Trott mistimes a pull, leading edge drops safely a few yards down the pitch
this bounces a little more than Trott is expecting, again shuffling in front of his wicket, hit on the thigh pad
fuller, angled towards off stump from over the wicket, played back to the bowler
drops a little short and Trott gets his paddle-pull right this time for a couple through midwicket - that's the 50 up for England, marked by a polite ripple of clappy hands
line and length in the channel outside off, Trott ain't interested
Hazlewood maintains the discipline shown by Australia's attack so far, in the corridor, Root is certainly not going to play at that
full and straight, not quite yorker length, comes back off a slight leading edge
this tails in quite lte, again pitched up on the stumps and Root chops it towards mid-on
bit of width, Root opens the face and takes one through backward point
length delivery outside the line of off, Trott defends it stoutly into the covers
comes forward and defends outside off
slow left-arm, round the wicket, tossed up and patted back
gets forward and works the ball, can't get it through the infield

pops the ball back, Voges gets Root caught and bowled! Never let it be said Michael Clarke doesn't know what he's doing. Voges tossed it up, Root advanced but the ball stuck a little on the pitch and came straight back off the face of the bat, the bowler tumbled forward and held it well
Eoin Morgan is the new batsman, works his first ball off the pads for a single straight up
length ball on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
continues over the wicket, length ball on the stumps, closes the face and nudges to midwicket
gives this a bit of air, comes forward and steers one in front of point on the drive
little ramp shot from Morgan, innovating an angle for himself and scooping a couple over his shoulder
leg-stump line, pushed back to the bowler
on the stumps, Morgan tickles one through midwicket
tossed up, opens the face and steers to point
watchful stuff from Trott, who dead-bats defensively into the off side
tossed up and dabbed through backward point for a single
